More information on these grants, including how to apply, can be viewed under the “Grant Program” tab online at VA Adaptive Sports Grant Program. All submissions will be accepted online at  http://www.grants.gov . The deadline for applications to be submitted is May 14.

Today, the U.S. Dept. of Veterans Affairs (VA) announced the availability of up to $15 million in grants for community organizations that provide adaptive sports, including therapeutic recreational opportunities for disabled Veterans & disabled members of the armed forces.

I was honored that my amendment to increase funding for the VA's Adaptive Sports Grant Program - an important program to help our veterans recover from the psychological scars of combat.- was included in the House's appropriations bill last year. https://www.va.gov/opa/pressrel/pressrelease.cfm?id=5225&fbclid=IwAR0eNIrpsaRZNZdB0-6NBLpL62hFOEo2shn_9XkrTyMcU3iVziWlMCq7ADI …

I was honored to sign on to this amicus brief allowing states to redirect Medicaid funding away from Planned Parenthood and other entities in the abortion industry. Taxpayers shouldn’t have to fund providers that perform abortions. https://twitter.com/michaelcburgess/status/1108126501277519873 …
